Manage Cell Algorithms

Use this task to enable or disable the Automatic Neighbor Relations (ANR) algorithms that are used for the main LTE cell configuration for all devices connected to the PW EMS. The Self-Organizing Network (SON) uses the Automatic Neighbor Relation (ANR) feature to generate relations between radio network entities (neighboring cells) automatically.

  1. From the navigation bar, click Settings > System.
  2. In the System Settings window, click Algorithms configuration and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    Enable/Disable Algorithms feature field

    This parameter is set to true by default to enable ANR algorithm on all cells. Enter false to disable the ANR algorithm for all cells.
    Cell down guard timer field

    A cell is considered as down by ANR service only after cell down guard timer expires. On expiry, this cell is marked as out-of-service and other cells are informed to delete this cell from its neighbor list. This parameter is set to 300 seconds by default. Enter from 0 to an unlimited number of seconds to change the default exipiry value for this timer.
Parent topic: Manage System Settings for Devices
